metadata.Title: CVE-2015-4508 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 41.0, when reader mode is enabled, allows remote attackers to spoof the relationship between address-bar URLs and web content via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4508` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '41.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
